resources.string: Choose a preset -OR- Tap a rhythm -OR- Type pattern manually (use presets as an example)

"This condition is based on the names of events in your calendars. You can choose either the start of a calendar event or the end of a calendar event.
If part of the event's name matches the text then the condition passes, e.g. if you put 'meeting' in the box, events named 'Work meeting' and 'Boring meetings' will trigger the event."

"I'm Llama. Your very own Location Aware Mobile Application. I use phone masts to figure out where you are, so I don't eat your battery trying to find a GPS signal. I'll need some training to start with. You'll need to tell me where I am now. Tap the areas tab to begin.
If you find me useful, please donate by pressing Menu, then Donate.
Please send feedback to kebabapps@gmail.com"
You need to train your Llama to identify your favourites area
The groundspeed velocity of an unladen Llama can reach 28mph
Not related to the Dalai Lama
Llama is a Location Aware Mobile Application
Llamas are like camels, but much more awesome
If phone masts are not accurate enough to determine your location, try using the other options in Experimental settings
Long-press an area to start teaching Llama about where you are
You can see which events have occurred by pressing the history button
You can see what triggered an event by pressing the history button
If you are going into a meeting, you can prevent Llama from changing your profile using the padlock button
You can long press a profile to activate and lock it
"Look in the Settings to make sure Llama doesn't reset the volume if you use your volume buttons"
"If you see 'Not added to any areas' between your other areas, tap the cell to teach Llama where the cell belongs"

"This tab shows you which areas you have trained your Llama to identify. Llama starts off with two areas: Home and Work. However, Llama does not know where you live or where you work. To teach Llama where you are, you need to physically be there.
Long-tap the area for your current location, or press the + button to create a new area. Llama will then ask you how long you plan on staying here. During that time, Llama will remember which phone masts are nearby, so that it can figure out where you are when you come back here.
The list also shows you how many phone masts (also known as cells) define each area. You can also use some experimental methods to determine your location by enabling them in Llama's settings (see Experimental)."

"This tab shows you which events you have told your Llama to perform. Llama comes with some pre-defined events. You can modify or delete these, or add more.
An event contains some conditions and some actions. When all of the conditions are met, Llama will perform the actions for the event.
Most events come in pairs; you need one to turn something on, then another to turn something off, so you'll usually create two events with the event conditions reversed. e.g.
Enter Home -> Change Profile Leave Home -> Change Profile
If you think events are occurring when they shouldn't be, you can press the history button to see what event happened, and what caused it.
You can also place shortcuts to events on your home screen/launcher. To do this, long tap an empty area of your home screen, choose Shortcuts, then Llama."

"This tab shows you which profiles you have told Llama to use. Llama comes with common profiles already defined, but you can change these or add more.
Profiles in Llama are similar to profiles in other non-Android phones; they let you group all of the different volume settings so you can change them with a simple tap. You can also tell Llama to change the profile automatically using events. Each profile can be given a notification bar icon, so you can quickly see which profile is activated.
You can also temporarily prevent Llama from changing the profile if you go to an important meeting. After a period of time, Llama will set the profile back to what it was. If you go to the settings screen, you can tell Llama to monitor your volume buttons, so if you manually set the volume to silent, Llama will turn on its profile lock."

"This tab shows you which phone masts Llama has seen recently. After you have trained your Llama about an area, you'll be able to see which area a phone mast (also know as a cell) belongs to.
If you didn't have much time to train Llama, you may see cells saying 'Not added to any areas'. You can manually add these to the correct area by tapping the cell in the list. This list also shows the time, so you can remember where you were at that time and add it to the correct area.
If a cell is added to two different areas, then unfortunately you do not have enough phone masts nearby to determine the difference between the two locations. Try enabling the Experimental location methods."
Last time that you used Llama, you used the quit button. The Llama background service has now been restarted. Use the quit button to disable it again.
WARNING: Log to LlamaLog is enabled. This file may get very big! You may want to turn it off at some point.
Enter a new name for the area
Give me a name for the new location
How long will you be at %1s for?
Position of a Recent Location Estimate
Which area do you want to remove %1s from?
Which area do you want to edit?
Which area do you want to add %1s to?
Enter a name for the new area
Now tap a condition or action to remove it
Select action to perform when triggered
Please fix these errors or remove the offending conditions/actions.
Trigger by %1s condition was not allowed
"Are you sure you want to delete '%1s'?"
Enter a label for the shortcut
Specify a custom set of actions for the shortcut
The Llama service must be running for shortcuts to work
"This will close Llama and disable its background service. To restart the service, tap the Llama icon in your home screen's application list."
Are you sure you want to import settings? This will DELETE any existing saved areas, profiles and events already in Llama!
Are you sure you want to export settings to your USB storage? This will DELETE any saved areas, profiles and events that are already on your USB storage!
"The shortcut refers to an event named '%1s' which no longer exists"
"The shortcut refers to a profile named '%1s' which no longer exists"
Failed to load settings. They have been saved to your USB storage.
Failed to load settings, and there was an error saving to your USB storage. Llama will die now :(
If you find this app useful, please donate beer money
Profiles are locked. Go to the profiles tab and press Menu to unlock.
Could not change profile because there is no profile named %1s
Import failed :( Please ensure that your data is in a folder named Llama on your USB storage
Import of %1s successful. Please restart Llama
You have no APNs. You can remove the APN actions from your events.
WiFi not turned off as it is connected
Bluetooth not turned off as it is connected to an audio device
Bluetooth not turned off as it is connected
Could not turn on Bluetooth, maybe airplane mode is turned on.
Did not reboot, phone uptime was %1s minute(s). For safety reasons, it must be at least 5 minutes.
Did not turn off, phone uptime was %1s minute(s). For safety reasons, it must be at least 5 minutes.

"To view maps in Llama you need to install the Llama Map addon.
This is because Llama does not have the internet permissions needed to download the maps from Google.
Like Llama, the map addon is free too."
You can prevent Llama events from changing profiles for a period of time. e.g. you are going into a meeting for an hour and want your phone to remain on silent
Will activate when profiles are manually unlocked
disable screen lock after an unlock
Choose an application with a name
Yes, I really want to reboot!
Yes, I really want to turn off the phone!
for %1s then turn off if not connected
for %1s minutes then turn off if not connected
enable account sync then request update
Please choose at least one Bluetooth device
Please choose at least one Wifi Network
"when calendar has a current event name containing '%1s'"
"when calendar does not have a current event name containing '%1s'"
"Calendar has a current event name containing '%1s'"
"Calendar does not have a current event name containing '%1s'"
Calendar condition must have a calendar event name, a calendar selected or a calendar event type selected.
Wired headset with no mic connected
when any wired headset is connected
when wired headset (no mic) is connected
when wired headset (with mic) is connected
Choose an area to not be in
"This will change your phone's sound settings according to the profiles shown in the profiles tab. The notification icon may also change depending on how the profile is defined."
"This will change the icon that appears in the notification bar. Use different icons to determine what your current settings are. The icon can be turned on and off in Llama's main settings."
"This will change the screen's brightness. Some phone's support 'automatic brightness'."

This will turn on the screen immediately. If the screen lock is not active, the screen will stay on until the inactivity time passes. If the screen lock is enabled, then the screen lock is shown and the screen will turn off after 2 seconds. NOTE: Your phone may not show a difference between dim, bright and bright with button lights
This will turn off the screen immediately. If the screen lock is enabled it will be activated.
This will change the music/media volume.
This will vibrate according to a set of predefined patterns, or you can create your own rhythm.
"This will disable mobile data by fudging your network provider's APN settings. This only works on GSM networks. It is compatible with the APNDroid widget."

This will turn Bluetooth on and off. You can choose to only turn off Bluetooth if there are no devices connected. You can also turn Bluetooth on for a short period of time, and then turn off automatically if no device stays connected.
This will turn Airplane mode on and off. This will also have the side-effect of disabling WiFi and Bluetooth. When Airplane mode is active, you will not be able to determine your location!

This will turn WiFi on and off. You can choose to only turn off WiFi if there is no WiFi network connected. You can also turn WiFi on for a short period of time, and then turn off automatically if no WiFi network stays connected.

"This will turn GPS on and off. This is not officially supported by Android, so may not work. If you have installed Gingerbread or higher (Android 2.3) then it definitely won't work. Nag Google if you want it to work."

This will reboot your phone. Be careful with your event conditions, so that you do not end up rebooting after your phone has rebooted. Llama requires your phone to have been switched on for at least 5 minutes for this action to occur.

This will turn off your phone. Be careful with your event conditions, so that you do not end up turning off your phone after your phone has rebooted. Llama requires your phone to have been switched on for at least 5 minutes for this action to occur.
This will enable or disable the account sync setting. You can also use this to force a sync to occur.
"EXPERIMENTAL: This changes the frequency of Llama's cell polling. This is only useful if it is enabled in the Experimental Settings."

"EXPERIMENTAL: This changes the frequency of Llama's WiFi polling. This is only useful if it is enabled in the Experimental Settings. If set to 'never' then Llama will piggy-back Android's own WiFi polling."

"EXPERIMENTAL: This changes the frequency of Llama's discoverable Bluetooth device polling. This is only useful if it is enabled in the Experimental Settings. If set to 'never' then Llama will piggy-back Android's own Bluetooth scanning."

"EXPERIMENTAL: This changes the frequency of Android's own location polling. This is only useful if it is enabled in the Experimental Settings. If set to 'never' then Llama will piggy-back other applications that request your location."
This will change the amount of time that your screen stays on after you have touched it.

"This will change the mobile data setting. This does not work on Gingerbread because Google deliberately broke it :'( If you are running 2.2.1 or less, you need to have the 'Mobile Data' setting enabled in your phones settings for this to work."
This will show a poorly implemented reminder in the notification bar.

"This will turn the screen lock on and off. Android does not provide a permanent way of doing this, so this may not work as you expect.
If your screen is on and unlocked: -enabling the screen lock won't show the lock until after the screen has turned off -enabling the screen lock (force) will turn off the screen and show the lock when it next turns on -disabling the screen lock will happen immediately (i.e next time you turn off the screen, you won't see the screen lock)
If your screen is locked and turned off: -enabling the screen lock will cause the lock to show next time the screen is turned on -disabling the screen lock immediately, will make the screen lock never appear and may mess up your home/search buttons -disabling the screen lock after unlock will show the screen lock once and then never again, until you reenable it.
If your screen is unlocked and turned off: -enabling the lock will show the screen lock after the screen has been turned off and on once. -enabling the lock (force) will make the lock screen appear next time the sceen is turned on.
If your home button stops working, you should not use this action. You may also have more luck if you use pattern lock rather than a pin/password lock."
"This allows you to control Llama's profile lock. You can use this to prevent Llama from changing your profile at certain times."
This allows you to run an application. Please give the list time to load if you have a lot of applications
This allows Llama to kill an application to the best of its abilities. Note that application killing in Android is limited, so this may not work as you expect.
This allows Llama to FORCEFULLY kill an application. This is not recommended and may cause the app to misbehave. This requires your phone to be rooted.
This condition is valid when you first enter ANY of the selected areas and remains valid until you leave the selected areas.
This condition is only valid when you leave ANY of the selected areas. (See Not in Areas condition)
This condition is only valid when you leave ALL of the selected areas, and stays valid whilst you are not in those areas.
"This condition is valid depending on you calendars' current events. You can specify the start of an event or the end of an event."
This condition allows you to filter an event to only occur on certain days of the week.
This condition allows you to perform events when your wired headset or headphones are connected or disconnected from your phone.
This condition allows you to perform events when your phone is connected to a PC or a charger, or if it is discharging.
This condition allows you to perform events when your phone starts up or before your phone shuts down.
This condition allows you to perform events when your battery goes below a certain level or rises above a certain level.

"This condition allows you to perform events when your signal strength goes below a certain level or rises above a certain level.
The condition will show you a preview of the current signal level when you edit it.
The values are in dBm.
Llama uses -150 as 'no signal'. Note that GSM signal can go as low as -113dBm."
"This condition allows you to performs events when your phone enters or leaves 'car dock' mode."
This condition is valid when any of the selected Bluetooth devices are conncted, and stays valid whilst they are connected to your phone.
This condition is valid only when none of the selected Bluetooth devices are connected. It will trigger when all of the specified Bluetooth devices have disconnected.
This condition is valid when ANY of the selected Bluetooth devices disconnect from your phone.

"This condition is triggered by changes to the Android Music player. NOTE: Different manufacturers decided to customise their media player, but do not provide any documentation for third party developers to interact with them :'("

"This condition allows you to filter events so they only occur during certain times of the day. You can make the time span over night (e.g. 10pm to 6am) to specify events that should only occur at night. The 'From' time acts as a trigger for this event. When the time matches the 'From' time, Llama will check the event's other conditions and run the event's actions."
Whether to use black or white notification icons (for Sense/Gingerbread)
How to let you know about profile changes. Ongoing notifications tell Android to avoid killing Llama
Whether to use 12-hour time pickers (less hour clicking ;)
"Whether to show APN/Mobile data toggle in Llama's menu. TIP: Create a shortcut for your home screen instead"
Whether to prevent Llama from changing profiles when you manually adjust the volume using the volume buttons
After locking profiles, unlock profiles after
"Whether to prevent invalid cell IDs and no signal from 'leaving' an area"

EXPERIMENTAL: Whether to wake the CPU to track cell changes more reliably. This may affect your battery life. When turned off, enter/leave events may lag. Usually this is not a problem, because the event will occur immediately when your phone wakes.
How often to wake the CPU
"EXTREMELY EXPERIMENTAL: Whether to use Android's built in location stuff. Place areas on a map, can be more accurate if you have WiFi enabled, but may have an effect on your battery life"
Use GPS to determine your location. This WILL eat into your battery life.
EXTREMELY EXPERIMENTAL: How often to check your location
EXTREMELY EXPERIMENTAL: Whether to turn on WiFi every so often to see if there are nearby WiFi networks
EXTREMELY EXPERIMENTAL: How often to check for WiFi networks
EXTREMELY EXPERIMENTAL: Whether to turn on Bluetooth every so often to see if there are nearby discoverable Bluetooth devices
EXTREMELY EXPERIMENTAL: How often to check for Bluetooth devices
Additional settings for logging purposes and diagnostics
The name used to identify this event
"Whether Llama should check this event's conditions and run its actions"
The name used to identify this profile
Whether to change the ringer, vibrate or silent mode when this profile is activated
Whether to change the ringtone when this profile is activated
Whether to change the default notification tone when this profile is activated
Whether to change the music/media volume when this profile is activated
Whether to change the alarm volume when this profile is activated
Whether to change the in-call/ear-piece volume when this profile is activated
Whether to change the system sounds volume when this profile is activated
Whether to change the Llama icon when this profile is activated
The volume to set the ringtone to
The volume to set notification tones to
The volume to set music/media to
The volume to set alarm sounds to
The volume to set in-call audio to
The volume to set system sounds to
Whether to change the ringtone volume when this profile is activated
Whether to change the notification volume when this profile is activated
Ongoing icon only notification not supported by Gingerbread and higher :(
Many thanks to the Llama translators:
"Unable to update area '%1s' because it no longer exists :("
"When in Airplane Mode you will be unable to 'enter' any areas because you aren't connected to the phone network!"
"Be careful with your conditions! Your phone must be switched on for at least 5 minutes for it to reboot, for safety reasons"
"Be careful with your conditions! Your phone must be switched on for at least 5 minutes for it to turn off, for safety reasons"
Your Bluetooth device must be paired with your phone. If this list is empty, turn on Bluetooth and try again.
"If this list is empty, turn on Wifi and try again. The wifi network must be in range or you must have already connected to it in the past and 'remembered' it."
WARNING: Buggy! Your home button may stop working until you reenable the keyguard. This may also make your SIM card lock act funny!
EXPERIMENTAL: You must have mobile data enabled in settings!
"Use a language that isn't your phone's usual language"
turn on the screen at low brightness
turn on the screen at normal brightness
turn on the screen and button lights at normal brightness
How to let you know about problems that might occur when Llama is in the background, such as event errors and profile locks
"Failed to read calendar %1s. You can turn off Error Notification in Llama's settings."
"Whether to change the volume back to the current profile's setting when you accidentally press the volume buttons."
This condition allows you to perform or filter events depending on when the screen is on or off.
"Whether to re-enable the 'use incoming call volume for notifications' checkbox when a profile with matching volumes is activated."
Remember to create another event for when it is outside of these times!
This condition is valid when any of the selected WiFi networks are connected, and stays valid whilst your phone is connected to them.
This condition is valid when any of the selected WiFi networks disconnect or are not connected, and stays valid whilst your phone is not connected to any of them.
"Whether to colour event conditions according to their current status. Green = true, red = false, underline = triggered events during last event test"

"This turns USB mass storage on and off. If your phone's manufacturer added other USB modes (e.g Media Sync, PC Suite), this may not behave correctly. TIP: Create a Llama shortcut on your home screen to toggle USB storage on and off with a simple click. No more annoying notification tapping :)"

This performs a media player action, such a play and pause. It is similar to pressing the Play/Pause, Previous or Next button on a headset. This depends on your media player to support these action, and not all media players will support all actions.
Select contacts who will be allowed override the ringer settings in this profile.
The volume to set the ringer to when one of your Noisy Contacts calls.
"Turn 4G on or off, if your phone supports it. If your phone doesn't support it, you may summon a spirit from a horrible place."
"EXPERIMENTAL: I don't own a 4G phone to test it on. Donations welcome!"

"Starts another application using the specified shortcut. You can use this to perform all kinds of actions within other applications. If an application isn't listed or the action you want to perform doesn't exist, let the app's developer know."
This condition allows you to performs events when you enable or disable airplane mode.
This action turns haptic feedback on and off. Haptic feedback is the vibration that your phone makes when you tap buttons on the screen.
Different phones behave differently. Use in combination with Screen Brightness to set the ACTUAL brightness.
WiFi sleeps when screen turns off
prevent WiFi from sleeping while plugged in
set WiFi to sleep shortly after the screen turns off
This action changes the advanced WiFi setting that controls when your phone puts WiFi to sleep. Note that some phones have a delay between the screen going off and WiFi going to sleep.

"Allows you to change the wallpaper of your home screen. This will use Android's wallpaper picker to let you choose and crop an image from your Gallery. The cropped image will be saved in the Llama/Wallpaper folder of your USB storage.
Android doesn't let applications change the Live Wallpaper :'("
This screen is for sound profiles. If you want to change Bluetooth, WiFi, etc, go back to the Events tab and create events to do your bidding.

EXPERIMENTAL: This condition triggers when another application places a notification icon in the notification bar. You must have Llama set as an accessibility service for this to work. You can use it to perform actions when an SMS or Google Talk message is received, or when some other application places an icon in the notification bar. WORK IN PROGRESS, GEEKS ONLY.
"EXPERIMENTAL: Please tick Llama in Android's accessibility settings!"
kill %1s with root privileges die! die! die!
"Could not kill package '%1s' because its name is invalid"
No other cells are ignored. Long-press a cell in the Recent tab to ignore some.
Sometimes you may have a cell that briefly appears in two areas. You can ignore those cells so they do not cause you to leave an area. Long-tap in the recent tab to ignore cells.
Event name contains... (separate multiple names with a vertical line)
This area has not been set up yet. Long-press it to start learning about nearby phone masts or tap items in the Recent tab to start defining this area.
Different phones treat screen brightness differently. You may have to turn your screen off and on before the change takes effect.
%1$s does not have any calendar events
%1$s does not have a calendar event named %2$s
when %1$s does not have any calendar events
when %1$s has a calendar event named %2$s
when %1$s does not have a calendar event named %2$s
Some of your calendar event names have spaces before or after them. Some Android keyboards insert spaces automatically. If you did not intend those spaces to be there, press Remove Spaces.

This lets you change whether your phone rotates the screen when you rotate your phone. Most phones only allow the rotation to be locked portrait or automatically switch between portrait and landscape.
Also activate profile lock. Other events will not be able to change the profile. When this number of minutes passes, Llama will switch back to the previous profile.
This action turns car mode on and off manually. Only supported by Android 2.2+.
Car mode is only supported by Android 2.2+
Llama failed to change the APN settings
There was an error reading your contacts :(
Beware of alarm clock apps that control their own alarm volume. e.g. some Samsung phones. Please install another alarm app from Google Play that does not do this.

This allows you to start an Android Intent. This is a very advanced function and needs the cooperation of third party applications. Llama comes with some pre-defined Intents. If you come up with a good one, please let other people know about it :)
Whether this event is delayed or repeating, requires confirmation and trigger filters
"Whether this event's actions keep firing for as long as the conditions hold"
"The number of minutes between each repetition of this event's actions."
"Whether this event's actions are run immediately or are run after waiting a certain number of minutes."
The number of minutes that must pass between this event being triggered and the actions being fired.
The number of additional seconds that must pass between this event being triggered and the actions being fired (for people with fast reactions or OCD :)
"If checked, a delayed event's actions won't fire if its conditions no longer hold true."
"Whether this event's actions will only be run after you confirm them via a notification."

"If more than one advanced option is selected:
-A confirmation will not be shown until after the delay.
-A repeating event will not start repeating until after the delay and/or confirmation."
WifiAccessPoint may not be supported by your phone.
"The event named '%1$s' requires confirmation to perform these actions:"
You can either run these actions now, save them for later, or clear the notification.
Whether to interrupt your current activity to show a dialog, or just place an icon in the notification bar.
This action turns WiFi hotspot manually. Only supported by Android 2.2+.
"Not all Android phones are created equally. Some phones won't respond to brightness changes until after the screen has been turned off and then on."

WARNING: Some phones will let you set the screen brightness so low that you cannot see the screen. Proceed at your own risk! You may be able to remove the battery and restart to get it back to normal.
This action turns the in-call speakerphone on and off. It only affects phone calls and not the other audio types (e.g. music)
Provides support for some Llama actions
Device Administrator is only supported on Android 2.2+
"Llama was not granted Device Administrator priviliges. See Android's Location and Security settings."

"This changes the screen lock password. You can use it to temporarily clear your password so that the screen lock does not show. This password will be stored in an encrypted format, which may be written to your USB storage if a Llama data error occurs or if you export your data manually. The password will be encrypted using the Llama Security Password in Llama's settings, which is never stored on your USB storage. However, other apps with root permission may be able to read the Llama Security Password! If you modify your Llama Security Password you will have to reenter the Change Password action's password."
Could not change your screen lock password.
There was an error saving your screen lock password. You may have changed the Llama Security Password. Please try reentering the screen lock password action.
Failed to decrypt your screen lock password, so it was not changed.
This is used to encrypt sensitive information defined in events. e.g. screen lock password

"This is used to encrypt sensitive information defined in events (for example: screen lock password). This is so that sensitive information is not written in plain text to your USB storage if you export your data.
If this password is changed, you will need to redefine any screen lock password actions that you have used.
You will not need this password again unless you change phones or reinstall Llama."

You should set a Llama Security Password. This is used to protected sensitive information when your events are written to your USB storage. It is separate from the keylock password or your Google account password. Do you want to set a Llama Security Password now?
Please enter a Llama Security Password, or press Cancel to keep your existing one
Your queued event must contain at least one condition, or be queued after at least one minute.

"This lets you create a one-off event. You can use it to perform another set of actions after a certain period of time. One the new event has fired once, it will be deleted.
If you set both the number of minutes to queue and add conditions, the queued event will only fire if those conditions remain true.
If you set only conditions, the queued event will only fire when those conditions are triggered."
The number of minutes after the original event fired that this event must wait before checking its conditions and running its actions.
The number of seconds after the original event fired that this event must wait before checking its conditions and running its actions.
"queue an event named '%1$s' after %2$s minutes and %3$s seconds"
Some events are hidden by your filter!
The notification tone to play when you use the reminder action
Whether the profile lock slider should show up to 8 hours or 24 hours.
"Llama normally works passively using the currently connected cell. These settings adjust Llama's alternative cell polling method."
"Whether to force your phone to stay awake when it's trying to see if the cell has changed. Some phones may need this."
Whether to turn on your screen briefly. WARNING: Turning your screen on and off a thousand times per day might damage it. I have no idea if it does, so use it at your own risk.
"The number of milliseconds to potentially keep your device awake for. You probably shouldn't set it for longer than 5 seconds if you value battery life."
Delay cancelled because conditions were no longer met
Repeating cancelled because conditions were no longer met
Please enter a Llama variable name
Please enter a Llama variable value

Llama lets you store some text that other events can then act on, letting you create horribly complex sets of events. You store text in named variables. You can have multiple named variables. As an added bonus, the variables are sent to Minimalistic Text Widget (MTW). Let MTW know the variable name as its Locale variable.
There was a problem launching Google Play. Donations can only be made through Google Play.
"when '%1$s' does not have a value of '%2$s'"
"when '%1$s' has a value greater than or equal to '%2$s'"
"when '%1$s' has a value less than or equal to '%2$s'"
This is used in conjunction with the Llama Variable action. You can use it to create events using the current values of Llama Variables.

"Do you really want to clear your variable names and values?
This should only be done to reset your variable usage. It will not trigger any events."
"No variables set. Create an event that has a 'Llama Variable' action to start using variables. A variable won't have its value set until the event that sets its value has run for the first time."
"Some phones don't start playing a ringtone when on silent. Make Llama play the ringtone instead. Untick if you hear two ringtones."

"This repeating event has no conditions, so will never be triggered.
If you want it to repeat forever consider adding a Phone reboot/startup condition.
Do you want to add this now?"
The number of dots to show in the icon.
Please choose a sound to play
Notification icon must change the icon or number of dots
Choose the volume (audio stream) that the sound will play through, or you can choose to cancel all sounds that Llama is playing:

"This will play a ringtone or notification tone. You can choose what audio stream should play the sound. Each of the audio streams has its own volume level, which Llama controls through its profiles.
A sound will play until it finishes and more sounds will be queued up. To stop sounds playing, use the notification icon that appears when playing sounds. This icon can be turned off in Llama's settings."

"Android's default ringtone picker doesn't let you pick music as ringtones. However, because Android is smarter than its fruit-based competitor you can use another ringtone picker!
I'd recommend Rings Extended by Googler Dianne Hackborn.
You should probably ignore any apps that claims to give away free music or try to sign you up for a £5 ringtone-of-the-week. Anyone who uses those services is a moron.
Anyways, do you want to search Google Play for an alternative ringtone picker?"
There was a problem starting Google Play :(
"Use the notification to stop the sound. Turn it on/off in Llama's settings."
Quick ways of doing some advanced stuff.
Delete cells from areas. Useful for when you change mobile network.
Delete wifi MAC addresses from areas
Delete wifi network names from areas
"Are you sure that you want to do this?! Make sure that you've taken a backup just in case you change your mind. You should quit and restart Llama after doing this."

"**THIS ONLY WORKS ON PHONES THAT HAVE BEEN HACKED/MODIFIED TO SUPPORT IT** You need to have Cyanogenmod 7+ installed on your phone for this to have any effect. This is a limitation of Android. Android does NOT normally let third-party apps control the network type.
Tedious warning aside, this lets you set the network type that your phone will connect to. Do some Googlin' to find your network type, but it's probably these:
Europe - GSM/WCDMA USA - either GSM/WCDMA or CDMA"
This might not work! GPS can only be changed on Android 2.2 and below, or some modified phones. This is a security-related limitation of Android to prevent apps from spying on you.
This might not work! Android 2.2 and above limited the effectiveness of apps killing other apps. If you have hacked/rooted your phone, try the alternative kill app action.
You have edited a repeated event. Do you want to check if its conditions are valid so that it can start repeating?
"All event names must be unique. Your queued event may not be recreated if another event already exists with the same name! Please change the queued event's name."

"You can also filter the events based on the event type and availability. If you leave the calendar and event name box blank, your condition will respond only to events that match all day or availability, etc.

NOTE: Not all calendar providers are created equally (e.g. some MS Exchange apps); click here to look at Llama's calendar debug viewer to see what Llama thinks is going on."
"Your device does not support Android's Device Administration feature :("
This triggers when a wired headset or Bluetooth headset is disconnected. Some phones may respond to this faster than the other conditions.

"This condition allows you to performs events when your phone is placed in a desk dock.
Note that your phone has to support the normal Android way of being placed in a desk dock. Some manufacturers like to customise this and don't behave properly. Also, some desk docks are actually cheap nasty lumps of plastic, rather than actual docks, so your phone doesn't know if it is docked."
when not in a desk dock
"Lets your Llama talk to you in a robotic voice. You can make it speak Llama variables by surrounding the variable name with two hashes. e.g. 'Lock is set to ##LockEnabled##'"

"**EXPERIMENTAL** This lets your run third party plugins for the popular Locale app. Locale plugins are available on Google Play. Some are free, some need you to hand over money. Llama DOES NOT guarantee that it will work with any of them!
There's currently a problem with plugins that rely on Locale's text and icons. These may not display properly, but should still work.
When you configure a Locale plugin you will need to press MENU to save your changes. The final button in the MENU-button menu is usually save."
Some plugins require you to press MENU and then the last menu item to save!
Choose a Locale plugin to run.

"Show your appreciation for my efforts working on Llama by donating some cash. You can donate as many times as you like. When you tap an item you will be sent to Google Play to view the up-to-date price and complete the process.
These are only suggestions of what I might buy :) Thanks!"
"You can hide the donate menu in Llama's settings :)"
Thanks for donating. You can now hide the Donate option in the menu. You can still donate more via the Llama? button.

This condition triggers when an app becomes the foreground activity or when it returns to the background. This requires Llama to ask Android for the currently active app every few hundred milliseconds. This interval can be configured in Llama settings.

"If you use the 'Active app conditon', Llama will check the current app every few hundred milliseconds. Smaller values will let Llama respond quicker, but may affect the performance of your phone. I recommend between 200ms to 1s"

"Recent versions of MIUI have permission management, which prevents Llama from changing call volume. You need to do this to make it work:
-Go to the super-user app -Find Llama's app details -Set 'Monitor Calls' to allow
This permission is misleadingly named and should not affect volume, but it does. Grrr. Llama DOES NOT do any weird stuff like record your phone calls."
This condition lets you create a group of other conditions. If any of those conditions is true, then the group is also true.

"This condition lets you create a group of other conditions. If all of those conditions are true, then the group is also true. NOTE: This is only needed when you want to place a 'And (match all)' inside an 'OR (match any)', as Llama treats normal events as 'And (match all)'"
"Whether to run this event's actions again if it is already true when another one of its conditions is triggered."

"Ice Cream Sandwich (Version 4.0+) no longer supports having a notification tone volume that is different from the ringtone volume.
You should edit your profiles so that they no longer do this, otherwise Llama will incorrectly think that the volume has changed and may activate the profile lock.
Android 4.0 - one step forward, another step back :("
Llama now requires that you select a volume level for the ringer or notifications when you set the ringer type to ring or ring+vibrate. Please modify your profiles accordingly.
Ice Cream Sandwich (Version 4.0+) no longer supports third party apps changing the APN settings.

"This condition lets you create events based on your phone's call state, either when it is in a call or not in a call. Depending on the setting, it will trigger when you -place a call or are called. -when the call ends."
Whether to prod the text-to-speak engine a bit harder when all speech has finished. Use when your music no longer works after speaking.
"The text to say for the above hack. The default is a dot, however some TTS engines will actually say 'dot'. Try curly brackets or pipe:{}|"

"Some audio streams (e.g. ringer and notification) are played through both the speaker and headphones. Music/media only plays through the headset if it is connected.
If you play through the ringer/notification stream you may notice your music stops playing. If this happens, enable 'Speak action cleanup hack' in Llama's settings. This only affects some phones and TTS engine combinations. Samsung TTS misbehaves. Bad Samsung!"
Enter something for Llama to say
In-app billing is not available on your phone or Market/Google Play version.
In-app billing is not available at the moment. Please try again later.

"This only works on modified phones with ROMs that support custom rotation angles. e.g. Cyanogenmod 7.
Avoid mixing simple and advanced rotation actions. Use 0° and 90° to return to normal.
The rotation may not switch immediately, depending on your ROM."
when the current app is not %1s

"You've got Llama set to show an ongoing notification, but hide the icon. Android does not actually let apps do this. Before Ice Cream Sandwich apps could use a transparent icon and set its date to far in the future. This had the effect of aligning the icon to the right. This is no longer possible. Please change the Notification Icon setting in Llama to one of the other modes."
Whether to change the notification icon to a warning icon when you change the volume.
Failed to write to location log
Whether to store all of the cells you ever see, so you can audit your movements. e.g. for timesheets.
Whether to store the Llama trail files on your USB storage or phone. Beware that saving on USB storage may have problems if you frequently use USB Mass Storage.

"This condition lets you specify events that happen when the screen is rotated. This may behave funny before Android 2.2, because it only reports portrait/landscape, but there's only 1300 of you stuck on 2.1.
This will only work when the screen is on, and if the current app supports rotation, because it piggy-backs Android's own sensor watching and so doesn't drain extra battery."
"The ringtone picker didn't open properly. May be your phone doesn't support this ringtone picker type :("

"You've picked 'silent' from the ringtone picker. Obviously, you can't play a silent sound, so you'll need to pick another one.
You may ask why I even bother letting the ringtone picker show 'silent'... well, you have Samsung to thank for that. The Galaxy S ringtone picker crashes if I ask it to hide 'silent'. http://stackoverflow.com/q/5874372/
On 3... 1, 2, 3... Thanks Samsung! *cheering and applause*"

"Llama has been installed to your SD card. This may happen if your phone's internal memory is low on space, or if you have asked Llama to be moved there.
Please be aware that Llama needs to run as a service in the background. When you connect your USB cable and use 'mass storage' mode to transfer files, Llama will be killed and won't be able to detect any conditions or run any actions.
When you've finished with 'mass storage' mode, Llama will eventually start again. You can speed up this process by turning off your screen.
Ideally, if space permits, you should have Llama installed on your phone' internal memory. View Llama's application info in Android's settings to do this."
when the next alarm is due (%1s)
This condition will trigger when the next alarm is due. This only works with the stock Android app, and apps that correctly update the NEXT_ALARM_FORMATTED Android setting.

"The next alarm is set for:
%1s
You can either have this condition trigger when this alarm fires, or you can have the condition pass if there is no alarm set.
e.g. when alarm is due > show reminder
-or-
Between 21:00 and 21:05, when there's no alarm > vibrate lots"
Event list now grouped. Edit events to create groups.
This triggers when the screen lock has been passed. If there is no screen lock, it will fire immediately.
Please choose ONE or TWO call states.

"Some phones are inept and don't report the volume levels correctly when you are in a phone call. This causes Llama to think the volume has changed when it hasn't. Make sure 'Ignore in-call volume changes' is ticked if Llama incorrectly locks your profile or changes to 'unknown profile' during a call."
"The action '%1s' cannot be run from a CUSTOM shortcut. For security, please create an event for it and create a NAMED event shortcut."
"LlamaTones let you change ringtones of other apps' notifications when you change profile."

"LlamaTones let you change the ringtone used by another app depending on the current profile.
In one of your profiles, create a LlamaTone and give it a helpful name. e.g. Gmail. You can then specify the ringtone that profile should use for Gmail notifications.
Then edit your other profiles' LlamaTones and set which ringtone that profile should use for Gmail.
The final step is to tell Gmail which LlamaTone to use. Do this by editing Gmail's notification settings. You will see a 'LlamaTone' picker in the ringtone selection, which you can use to choose the LlamaTone.
To delete a LlamaTone, you must 'Clear/cancel' it from all profiles."
Tap to name a new LlamaTone
A LlamaTone named %1s already exists. Please choose another name or use the existing LlamaTone.

"You haven't set up any LlamaTones. Please edit one of your profiles to start using them.
LlamaTones allow you to change the sound played by a third party app depending on the current profile."
Choose another profile that should use those LlamaTones
Choose a ringtone type or cancel this LlamaTone

"Llama couldn't find any ringtone pickers.
DOES NOT COMPUTE!!!"

"You can't select a LlamaTone to use as a LlamaTone.
That'll make the universe explode."
Whether the WiFi hotspot is enabled or not. This event does NOT trigger events! It can only filter other events.
Please enter a new group name:
Cannot change brightness that low in a Custom Event shortcut. Create an event and a named event shortcut instead! This is for security reasons!
The command that Llama uses to shutdown your phone. Try a different one if you are rooted and your phone does not shutdown.
The command that Llama uses to reboot your phone. Try a different one if you are rooted and your phone does not reboot.
"Whether Llama should suspend all wifi polling when it detects that a WiFi hotspot is enabled. This will only work with phones that use Android's normal WiFi hotspot."
What events descriptions should I show you?
"Ice cream sandwich no longer allows you to have a different ringer and notification volume. What d'ya wanna do?"

"You need to enable Llama as a Device Administrator to perform certain security related Android functions. If you decide to uninstall Llama, you will need to DISABLE Llama as a Device Administrator. This can be found in Android's security settings.
Otherwise, Android will give you an extremely unhelpful 'uninstall not successful' message.
Thanks for remembering :)"

"When ticked, Llama will run a confirmable event's actions immediately when tapped in the notification drawer, without popping up a dialog box. You'll need to use the 'clear' button or swipe-away the notification to clear it."

"This condition will trigger when the specified NFC tag is detected by your phone. Your phone will need to have NFC enabled (which Llama sadly cannot control).
Llama does not get told when the NFC tag is no longer nearby, so this condition is always false at other times.
If you need to create a repeating event, you will need to use Llama variables to store the fact that an NFC tag has been seen, and then some other event and condition to clear the Llama Variable."
"Do you want to use the tag '%1s' in this condition?"
Llama has found a tag! Please give it a friendly name:
"The friendly name for NFC tag '%1s' was modified"

"Llama does not know about any NFC tags.
Tap one on your phone now to name it."
Your phone does not support reading NFC tags :( To fix this please purchase a new phone or use your imagination... you may find making beep-beep noises helpful.
You can also use another tag by tapping it on your phone
NFC is not currently enabled. Turn it on to add a new tag
Please see the Kebabapps website to donate to translators!
"Whether a notification icon is shown when Llama's play sound action is running. If you turn this off, you won't be able to stop the sound that Llama is playing!"
This condition will trigger when your phone starts or stops roaming.
"Tap here to manage any NFC tags that you've named."
"Whether Llama should care about NFC tags or not. If you use another app to detect NFC tags, you should untick this. This setting does not affect your phone's global NFC enable setting."

"This condition passes when the mobile data tickbox is ticked, otherwise false. This relies on an undocumented Android API. It MAY NOT WORK for all phones.
Ask Google politely that you want to be able to do this and they may implement a proper API for it.
This condition will be delayed for a few seconds until some internal Android mobile data network intent occurs."

"This conditions passes when the phone is connected to a mobile data network (that's the G,E,3G or H). It might also work for LTE/WiMax, but I don't know how they behave, because the UK is stuck in the dark ages. We have rats roaming the streets and Blackadder is still hanging about."
when mobile data is not connected
"LlamaTone rate limiting: Use the slider to limit how often the LlamaTone gets played. Useful for GTalk or other IM apps."
"You're about to import an event into Llama. You should check that it isn't going to do anything malicious."
"Llama failed to change the ringtone for profile '%1s'. Please choose the ringtone again."

"This screen will let you format an NFC tag for use with Llama.
You need to do this so that the tag reliably triggers Llama, rather than popping up the 'tag found' activity.
Tap the tag against your phone now to format it. This will remove any data on the tag. The tag will NOT be marked as read only.
Once formatted, you'll be able to use the tag in the condition. If Llama has never seen this tag before you will also be asked to name it."
"Set the 'key' to blank to remove that row. Surround variable names with two hashes to expand them in string extra (e.g. ##variablename##)."

Android decided that Airplane mode should be a secure setting. Llama can only change Airplane mode if your phone is rooted. Blame Google for this. Bad Google! Stop changing things for the worse without providing alternatives.

Ringtone pickers in Android usually return a content:// URI, which points to an ID in the media database. If you move Llama between phones or switch roms, the same file may not receive the same ID. Enabling this causes Llama to store the file path instead for the Play Sound action and LlamaTones.

"Ice Cream Sandwich (Version 4.0+) doesn't really do much with system volumes any more.
In fact, you may find that your ringer volume gets set to the system volume you have set.
You PROBABLY want to UNTICK the system sounds tickbox.
Press save to let this profile change system volume or cancel if you want to edit the profile."

"The number above is your phone's current signal level. GSM networks use a range between -113 (no signal) and -51 (full signal).
Llama will report an artificial value of -150 when in airplane mode or when out of service. Note that some phones are daft and still report a good-enough signal strength even when you're metres underground on a tube train.
You may want to combine a low-signal condition with a mobile-data disconnected condition as it is a more reliable way of detecting a working connection."

"Your phone/tablet's software has a horrible bug that prevents Llama from turning Wifi on and off.
There is an issue logged on code.google.com.
Please check for any updates to your device or custom ROM.
In the meantime, you should remove any toggle wifi actions or hide the message from appearing again. It'll also be good to watch the issue on code.google.com by pressing the 'view website' button."
Could not resolve item to a file path, so it will be stored as a Content URI.
Llama could not get root access in time. Please check your SU app.
Search events by name and description
Show events in groups or a list
Allows the application to set a Llama variable. This may cause events that use Llama variables to trigger unexpectedly.

"Argh! Llama almost fell over while changing your device's wifi state. It may have changed, it may not have changed, but either way your device almost killed Llama.
Your device requires that Llama has the 'android.permission.INTERACT_ACROSS_USERS_FULL' or 'android.permission.INTERACT_ACROSS_USERS' permission to toggle WiFi.
These are system permissions which Llama will never be able to have :'( Please check for any updates to your device/ROM."
when phone network code is not %1$s:%2$s

"This condition is based off the currently connected phone network's ID. This is made of two parts: a country code and a network code. Look at the recent tab to see what country and network codes your phone is connected to, or you can look on Wikipedia."
"This condition uses the currently connected phone network's ID. The MCC is the country code of the phone network, and MNC is the network code. If you leave a box blank it will match any value."

Llama will fire an event when all conditions are met, and one condition has caused it to trigger. This option lets you prevent actions from occurring if a certain type of condition triggers the event. Untick the condition to prevent it from triggering.
"Please add some conditions to your event. Once you've added some you will be able to deselect the conditions that you do not want to act as triggers."
Successfully formatted tag as Llama tag! You can either format another one, or just use this one

"Failed to format tag for Llama.
You can try formatting it manually by installing an NFC Tag Writer app from the Play Store, then writing the special Llama URL to the tag:
%1s"

"You have chosen a ringtone or notification volume, but the ringer mode is set to silent or vibrate.
Please set the ringer mode to ring or ring+vibrate, or set your ringtone and notification volume to zero."
Type or paste the Llama URL in the box:
"The vibrate pattern to buzz when Llama's profile lock automatically expires. Use a blank value for no vibration."
"Shows a brief message at the bottom of the screen using Android' toast user interface. You can show the value of variables by surrounding it with two hashes. e.g. The value is ##Blah##."

"Enable this service to let Llama capture notifications.
You do not need to enable this accessibility service unless you use the App Notification condition.
If you have a dodgy Samsung phone your phone may begin speaking to you. Change the settings for the Android TalkBack service to fix this."
"Failed to run a Locale plugin '%1$s: %2$s' for event '%3$s'. Please try recreating the event's actions"
